content: How can I help you today?

I’ve been having a lot of trouble sleeping lately, and my partner suggested I talk to someone, so here I am. I’m honestly not sure this will help, but I’ve been really stressed with everything going on at work and just can’t seem to shut my mind off at night.

It sounds like you’ve been struggling with sleep and feeling overwhelmed by stress lately, especially with work taking up so much mental space. Your partner suggesting this shows they care, and it’s great that you decided to give this a try. What’s been on your mind most in those moments when you’re trying to sleep?

I just keep thinking about everything that could go wrong at work. I’m terrified of getting fired and not being able to provide for my family. Then I spiral into worrying about bills, being a good partner and parent, and it just piles up until I’m wide awake with no way to shut it off.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot on your shoulders, with worries about work, your family, and financial responsibilities all building on each other. That weight can feel incredibly hard to manage, especially when it keeps you up at night. It’s clear how deeply you care about your family and responsibilities—what helps you handle these worries during the day?

During the day, I try to push through and focus on work, but it feels like I’m just surviving rather than really handling it. Sometimes I use my phone to distract myself, but that doesn’t really help much either. It’s like these thoughts never really leave, and I don’t know how to stop them.

It sounds like you’ve been doing your best to keep moving forward, even with those thoughts constantly in the background. Finding ways to temporarily distract yourself is understandable, though it seems like the underlying worries are still there, especially at nighttime. It must be exhausting to feel like you’re “just surviving” rather than finding relief. Have you noticed anything—however small—that helps even a little when you’re feeling most overwhelmed?

I honestly haven’t found much that really helps. Sometimes I try to take deep breaths, but it’s hard to stick with it when my mind is racing. Other times, I just give up and scroll through my phone, even though I know it probably makes things worse. I feel kind of stuck.

Feeling stuck can be really frustrating, especially when you've tried things like deep breathing but find it difficult to keep your mind focused. It sounds like you’re aware that some of your habits—like scrolling through your phone—might not be helping, but you're still trying to figure out how to break that cycle. You’re showing a lot of self-awareness and effort, even in the middle of such tough moments. What does being “unstuck” look like to you? What would you hope to feel or experience if this got better?

I guess being “unstuck” would mean being able to sleep without lying awake, worrying about everything. I’d want to wake up feeling rested and actually have the energy to be present with my family and do well at work. Honestly, I just want to stop feeling like I’m failing all the time, you know?

What you’ve described—feeling rested, having energy, and being present with your family while succeeding at work—sounds like something really meaningful for you. It’s not just about sleep; it’s about showing up in the way you want for the important parts of your life. Feeling like you're failing must be really heavy to carry, especially when you're working so hard just to get through each day. What do you think might help bring you closer to feeling rested and confident again?
Sorry, I don’t think I have an answer right now. I think I’m okay to end the conversation. Thank you for speaking about this with me.
